reviewText: John Nettles made Barnaby famous. These episodes in a new package is perfect for anyone who's had not already bought the separate sets. Never a bad Midsomer Murder. It has been a TV hit since Noah loaded both the TV and DVD player. One of the greatest successes in British crime mystery series that has ever been produced, and it still rolls on. New episodes no longer have Nettles as star, but all of this mega set has him in the lead. There is a good supporting regular cast, and each episode has guest stars. High-profile stars beg to be killed or become a murderer on this show, it's been said.Other packaged groups of the series: "Midsomer Murders-The Early Cases Collection", "Midsomer Murders-Barnaby's Casebook", "Midsomer Murders-Village Case Files", and now Mayhem and Mystery Files."Subtitles on each episode, one per disc. Most Midsomer episodes run about 100 min. each.Former set 13: 1 Dance with the Dead - Death by vintage automobile. Where's the girlfriend?2 The Animal Within -- A missing old villager is not as strange as finding a visit from a dead niece.3 King's Crystal -- Art glass workers possibly murder family rivalries.4 The Axeman Cometh -- Music festival, Can Barnaby do his bit? Murder rocks.Former set 14: 5 Death and Dust --murder related to an intended marriage between 2 older folk with children quite vocally unfavorable to the idea. See Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin) playing the former mother-in-law to the male of the pair. Rare 1 murder episode.6 Picture of Innocence --has to do with shootings, digital vs film, even a camera duel, but the murders are identical MO head bashings, all by the same odd metal instrument. Well it is a part of a large camera of sorts. Barnaby becomes something of a suspect.7 They Seek Him Here --a director plods on in a cheap version of Scarlet Pimpernel, complete with guillotine on set. The murder apparatus predictable, but certainly not the murderer. Not for children..8 Death in a Chocolate Box --again provides the picturesque setting, like calendar photos, but a deep dark secret from the inside of the jail cell, cons now outside, & corpses leave stains on panoramic vista. Can Barnaby make tranquility return to the village?.Former set 15: 9 Blood Wedding -- Barnaby distracted not only with daughter Cully's wedding but a wedding murder..10 Shot at Dawn  --Expect the rare bit of Midsomer nudity here. A WWI memorial reignites families who take violence personally and reciprocally.11 Left for Dead -- Barnaby takes on Dunstan, the wee town of multi-murder and old mysteries.Former set 16: 12 Midsomer Life -- Magazine editor found dead, just the beginning of Barnaby finding crimes and secrets kept too long.13 The Magician's Nephew-- Is witchcraft is to blame? Paganistic cult is up next for Barnaby.14 Days of Misrule -- That explosion is not from a Christmas cracker. Barnaby and Jones gets on the case to same themselves from worse duty.15 Talking to the Dead -- Village of Monks Barton misses couples. Is it really ghosts?Bonus episode: The Magician's Nephew with commentary by John Nettles and Jane Wymark.I own them all, and you will want all of them too, eventually. SIX-star murder mystery.

reviewText: I am completely hooked.  Started watching on PBS on Thursday nights but it's one hour of the current episode with the final hour the following week.  I will be sorry to see Tom Barnaby leave/retire but John looks like he will continue the thoughtful detective process.  Same with Joyce and Cully, Tom's wife and daughter.  And what I REALLY like is the real people - no gorgeous girls with low necklines or guys posing for abs pictures:-)  Am going to have to go visit Midsomer county!

reviewText: This is one of the long running murder mystery series that is still going on I believe. I've been trying to get them all but it is a quest that is difficult on the bank account.Much to my delight they are starting to box them up in sets which makes it easier to procure and with some savings.Around Christmas time Amazon offered this set for 50 bucks.. That was a no brainer in my sceme of things. If you're a murder mystery fan Midsomer Murders are required viewing

reviewText: Do enjoy these British mysteries--you get 2-3 murders per disc!!  John Nettles is the perfect Chief Inspector who plays his role with a quiet & warm approach.  His interactions with his wife are amusing. The settings give an interesting glimpse into rural life.  These series are "keepers".
summary: Many, many murders for your purchase price
